intro: Melandrium regium, commonly known as the royal catchfly, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family, characterized by its showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in sunny, well-drained environments. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are upright and often branched. Melandrium regium is known for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its delicate appearance.
